deviceScenarios.cgmSubtitle: The glucose sensor transmits values in near real-time. The platform does not make diagnosesâ€”it explains what the dynamics mean and how to gently stabilize diet and behavior.
deviceScenarios.spikeExplanation: if there is a spike - AI explains the reason in behavioral language
deviceScenarios.stabilizationMotivation: if there is stabilization - AI enhances motivation
deviceScenarios.glucoseSpikeDescription: Sharp fluctuations in glucose levels are more frequent than usual. The system recognizes a pattern of instability and offers a behavioral explanation.
deviceScenarios.glucoseSpikeAIResponse: Today, your glucose levels changed sharply more often than usual. This is not a diagnosis, but a signal of instability. Would you like an explanation of why this might be happening and what steps can help stabilize the dynamics?
deviceScenarios.glucoseSpikeSecondOpinion: I can explain with two approaches: Opinion A - physiology and metabolics, Opinion B - behavioral lifestyle. You can compare and choose the one that suits you best.
deviceScenarios.glucoseStabilizationDescription: The glucose level has become more stable. The system reinforces positive reinforcement and motivation.
deviceScenarios.glucoseStabilizationAIResponse: Glucose has become more stable - this is a good sign. The body can more easily regulate energy and mood.
deviceScenarios.sleepHRVSubtitle: We track not only the amount of sleep but also the quality of nervous system recovery through heart rate variability.
deviceScenarios.recoveryDeteriorationDescription: Sleep quality has decreased, and HRV is also declining. The system recognizes an overload mode and suggests gentle recovery.
deviceScenarios.recoveryDeteriorationAIResponse: Sleep has become less restorative, and HRV has also decreased. This is a sign of a general overload mode. Gentle recovery is important, not discipline.
deviceScenarios.recoveryDeteriorationSecondOpinion: Would you like a detailed explanation of the reasons? I can show the physiological and lifestyle/behavioral explanations side by side so you can choose the most useful one.
deviceScenarios.recoveryImprovementDescription: Sleep quality is improving, and HRV is increasing. The system confirms the body's successful adaptation.
deviceScenarios.recoveryImprovementAIResponse: Recovery has intensified, and the nervous system is responding better. This means the body is adapting and gaining resources.
deviceScenarios.activitySubtitle: The platform does not just count steps - it assesses the body's adaptation to the load.
deviceScenarios.overloadDescription: The load exceeds the recovery window. The system warns of a-disbalance without an alarm tone.
deviceScenarios.overloadAIResponse: The load is higher than the recovery window. This is not bad, but a balance is needed, otherwise the nervous system will start to reduce adaptation.
deviceScenarios.balanceDescription: Load and recovery are synchronized. The system confirms optimal adaptation.
deviceScenarios.balanceAIResponse: Load and recovery are moving in sync. The body adapts well and tolerates training stress.
deviceScenarios.accumulatedFatigueDescription: The pace of the load exceeds the speed of recovery. The system suggests gentle ways to exit.
deviceScenarios.accumulatedFatigueAIResponse: It seems you are moving faster than you can recover. I can suggest ways for gentle recovery to avoid accumulated fatigue.
deviceScenarios.platformLanguage: The platform never formulates it as a "disease" or "danger". Only as a "trend", "signal", "adaptation", or "resource". This makes the interaction psychologically safe and sustainable.
deviceScenarios.dynamicsMeaning: We track dynamics, not single values. Meaning is born in time, not in a number.
